comment: I loved Professor Allentini. He was very funny and caring. He is a parent and definitely remembers his college days, so he is very understanding. There were only 3 essay (with drafts that had to be uploaded as well), and 1 or 2 discussion posts. Very easy to keep up with.
I had a lot of issues going on this past semester and he was very caring. He class is very easy, and the topics of the essays are not boring. This class is an easy A ,take it if you can !
I recommend taking this class with Prof Allentini if you have the chance. Hes very kind and truly cares about his students. His class was very manageable and did not stress me out!

This class is definitely a breather class to take if you are taking other heavy classes. Just turn in college-level papers and you are bound to get 100s on every assignment. The only thing that was a bit annoying is that he never gave feedback on the papers and the in-class sessions were extremely unproductive. But other than that he is a cool guy

Prof. Allentini was amazing for me this semester. Super nice guy, loves to chat, and never held us longer than an hour in the class. Obviously since it is an english class you have to write papers, but he is not the kind of prof to take points off because of something super subjective. Very empathetic and understanding about the pandemic. Love him!

I took this class entirely online during the coronacation. The class was entirely a series of essays assigned throughout the course. There were no other assignments or exams. He didn't teach at all. He grades fairly, but barely gives any feedback. The class was an easy A, but I wouldn't recommend him if you actually want to learn.
He is an easy professor. We had a total of 3 essays to do and a few discussion posts. The essays were not difficult at all.

He was an easy professor, if you arent the best at english I would take him. We wrote very few papers and he was never a rough grader. Very few discussions or assignments mostly just occasional essays. he was incredibly understanding this semester especially with covid & easy to reach out to. However, he doesnt really give any feedback.

Very chill person, but it honestly seemed like he didn't know what he was doing. He graded everyone's first paper wrong, then when someone emailed him about it, he went back into that person's paper and marked on it more. He is very difficult to work with, and very lazy. He didn't even read the last 2 papers we wrote. Learned nothing. Avoid

He is an easygoing professor, but he literally does not teach you anything about being a good writer. He just shows up for lectures and talk about random things. Nothing English-related. The class is an easy A, but you will be more stressed out because he is inconsistent with grading, and he does not communicate with students when he is needed.

The essay topics are easy enough to make an A in the class. But professor allentini himself is one of the worst professors I've ever taken. He doesn't provide guidelines on how to be a better writer. He just assigns random assignments. He does not communicate with his students. Despite the class being very easy I wouldn't take him with anything.

Professor Allentini was AMAZING. Even though he would get off topic, he was hilarious and made the class very enjoyable. He made his assignment directions very clear and didn't grade too harshly. He also truly cared about his students and was very into what was going on in our lives. I would definitely take him again if I had the chance.

Professor Allentini is my favorite professor i've ever taken at KSU. He makes it very easy to pass the class. He does get off topic a lot but i think that he's hilarious. He also really really cares about his students. Professor Allentini is great wish he would have taught 1102.

Did not teach anything all semester, his "lectures" consisted of a dialogue with another student and other random topics (like how to hunt and fry a squirrel). Disorganized, inflexible and impossible to communicate with when necessary. Does not provide grading rubric, and grades assignments based on unclear criteria.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: So funny and extremely laidback. Great professor.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria
